abstract.description: A dataset of 1000 events taken in 2011 by the ATLAS Detector, used in the Physics Masterclasses W Path

files.description: ATLAS Masterclass WPath 2014 dataset 1 file index

usage.description: The dataset can be analysed by using MINERVA, which can be found on the linked site in the section "Measurement". There you will also find a tally sheet and links to instructions on how to analyse the data found in the dataset. The section "Identifying Pariticles" will show how to find out which detector signature hints at which particle. "Identifying Events" details how to categorise events. Using the knowledge of these two sections, one can use the prescriptions in "Measurement" to find out how the proton is structured and to hunt for the Higgs particle.

abstract.description:
A dataset of 1000 event display files accessible via
      MINERVA as part of the Masterclasses W-Path. The events were recorded in 2011
      by the ATLAS detector.

files.description:
ATLAS Masterclass WPath 2015 dataset 1 file
      index

usage.description:
The dataset can be analysed by using MINERVA, which
      can be found on the linked site in the section "Measurement". There you will
      also find a tally sheet and links to instructions on how to analyse the data
      found in the dataset. The section "Identifying Pariticles" will show how to
      find out which detector signature hints at which particle. "Identifying Events"
      details how to categorise events. Using the knowledge of these two sections,
      one can use the prescriptions in "Measurement" to find out how the proton is
      structured and to hunt for the Higgs particle.

abstract.description:
A dataset of 1000 event display files accessible via
      HYPATIA as part of the Masterclasses Z-Path. The events were recorded in 2012
      by the ATLAS detector.

files.description:
ATLAS Masterclass ZPath 2015 dataset 1 file
      index

usage.description:
The dataset can be analysed by using HYPATIA, which
      can be found on the linked site in the section "Get to work! -> Data samples and tools".
      There you will also find a tally sheet and links to instructions on how to analyse the
      data found in the dataset. The section "Identifying Pariticles" will show how to
      find out which detector signature hints at which particle. "Identifying Events"
      details how to categorise events. Using the knowledge of these two sections,
      one can use the prescriptions in "Get to work! -> Do it!" to rediscover the Z boson
      and to hunt for new particles.

      details how to categorise events. Using the knowledge of these two sections,
      one can use the prescriptions in "Get to work! -> Do it!" to rediscover the Z boson
      and to hunt for new particles.

The dataset can be analysed by using HYPATIA, which
      can be found on the linked site in the section "Get to work! -> Data samples and tools".
      There you will also find a tally sheet and links to instructions on how to analyse the
      data found in the dataset. The section "Identifying Pariticles" will show how to
      find out which detector signature hints at which particle. "Identifying Events"
      details how to categorise events. Using the knowledge of these two sections,

abstract.description: The ATLAS open data dataset is comprised of real data recorded with the ATLAS detector in 2012 and matching simulated data. The set of real data has an integrated luminosity approximately 1fb^-1 centre-of-mass energy of 8 TeV. Events come from period D of the 2012 data taking of the ATLAS experiment.

files.description: DataEgamma file index

methodology.description:
Both real and simulated data is subjected to a loose event preselection to reduce processing time by reducing the overall number of events that have to be analysed.
      The preselection consists of a set of object selection criteria and a subsequent event selection acting on these preselected objects.

relations.description: ATLAS samples for 2016 open data release

system_details.release: ATLAS Software for 2016 open data release - V1.1

title: ATLAS 2012 data Egamma-string sample for 2016 open data release

usage.description: You can access these data through the ATLAS Virtual Machines and Software. More documentation is available at:
